channel.title: Distrelec Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6994] Language switch issue
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=LED-Lampe+E27&filter_Farbtemperatur=6000+K&filter_Farbtemperatur=4000+K&page=1&pageSize=10&lang=de
  2. Try to change language in the shop.
  3. Result: Mixed languages.

If in the URL the "&lang=de" is removed then the language switch works.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: FYI: Most probably somebody added the "&lang=de" to the URL in one of the recent "features or bugfixes".

productlist.js:

var currentQueryUrl = Tc.Utils.joinUrl(urlObject) + '&lang=' + language;

I removed this part " + '&lang=' + language" and the lang parameter was not added anymore.
committed to v3.4.3.1 hotfix branch
Hallo Beat, please test on test.distrelec.ch, thanks.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6989] Categories not shown in FE, which still have products
item.description:
As discussed, we have categories that are not shown in the upper category level, because they have been deactivated in HMC.

Please check.

Example: http://www.distrelec.ch/de/komponenten/passive-bauelemente/widerstaende/smd-und-schichtwiderstaende/c/cat-L3D_525338

Not shown on parent site:
http://www.distrelec.ch/de/komponenten/passive-bauelemente/widerstaende/c/cat-L2-3D_528721
item.summary: Categories not shown in FE, which still have products

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: will be solved tomorrow morning.

New implementation contains:

  • detect search bot
  • only deactivate categories from CH DE channel source
  • if on the website results are found for a category, it will be activated again automatically
  • extended logging functionality of the check deactivated cats cronjob
  • added new configuration parameter "switchoff.categorydeactivating.logic" to deactivate this logic completly

Direct SQL query to activate all deactivated cats:

UPDATE categories item_t0 SET item_t0.p_donotdispalyinfe  = 0 WHERE item_t0.p_donotdispalyinfe  = 1
ready for Q deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6977] Mobile Homepage not working
item.description: Mobile home does not work properly anymore. It looks as if it's using the wrong page as a source for the products. Right now it's using the visuals from the extended prodcut carpet from the actual homepage (desktop) and the ones from the prodcut carpet from the mobile home cms page.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Can be linked to this issue : http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-6975

The issue here is based on the redirection issue. Because the cms page www.distrelec.ch/cms/mobilehome can't be accessed but gets redirected to the acutal homepage, the mobile homepage shows now the content from the desktop homepage.
Hi Rene, please have a look, thx.
It works for me, Mobile and Desktop!
works for me. can you please test again?

FYI: Attached screenshot is not the mobile home page but the actual desktop homepage!

Instead there should be only one old product carpet component with the title "Welcome to Distrelec"
Screenshot from my mobile phone
Screenshot from my mobile desktop
Did you try to clear the cache?

Yes sure, still not working properly. If it was working you would see 9 products and the "Welcome to Distrelec" message also on http://m.distrelec.ch/en/mobile/cms/mobilehome
Could you please investigate further?

@Nabil
Can you please have a look into this?

Problem is the cache of the homepage: DISTRELEC-6832
The cache has been disabled for now.

@Adi
can you please fix the implementation.

cache disabled in the runtime and in the config files of the production servers.

cache.homepage.time=0

Caching key now includes the page PK. This results in a different caching key for normal and mobile home.
Fixed as soon as v3.4.3.2 (or v3.4.4 or v3.5) is deployed.

Testing results:

  • DE: Ok.
  • CH: Not Ok. -> Too many redirects.
Please have a look, in CH it is not working on Q: Too many redirects.
@Rafael: Most probable a misconfiguration at Sevenval. They redirect to themselves.

As the issue in CH is not related to this ticket it is not a blocker for the deployment this night. Ticket will be created with sevenval. I assume this problem is only occuring in Q as we had a similar issue in the past and it was a configuration problem on Q.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6902] Distrelec Online Survey Form
item.description:
Please create a new form page and a thank you page with the fields and text you find in the attached document. It can mostly be based on the education registration page (/education/register) For this request I suggest following URLs:

/selection/register
/selection/register/success

If the second checkbox at the end of the register page is activated the customer subscribes to the Newsletter. All fields and checkboxes except this one (newsletter) are mandatory to submit the registration.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Attached you find all the information that has to be put on the pages and how it should look like.

Hi,
after discussion with Katherine Hetzel, we decided to use the following URL form:

distrelec.ch/survey/{vX}

"vX" is the version number, if the version number is not mentioned in the URL, then we take v0. The survey, should have a validity range dates.
As discussed: should be checked into v3.4 next week, thx.

Hi all,

I implemented a generic solution for the online surveys. With this solution, the marcom team should be able to create and publish surveys without help of the dev team. The architecture is the following:

  • An online survey is identified by its version, is composed by multiple sections and is available from start date and end date. It can also be available only for some CMS sites.
  • A section is composed by multiple questions and it has a position in the survey.
  • A question has a name, value, position in the section, a type (text, email, checkbox, radio, dropdown, textarea or hidden). It can be mandatory or not. The answer can also be persisted to the database or not (e.g., the acceptance of terms of use does not require to be persisted). A question may also have some possible answers. (c.f. screenshot)

Note: I created also an export job which will export answers once a week.

BR,
/Nabil.
Hi Nabil, great work. Can it be implemented for any kind of Survey??

Hi angel,

In theory YES. Who should take over this ticket ?
Can be tested after deployment of v3.4.4 on Q

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6875] FF - Export query update
item.description:
An url rewritting optimization have been implemented on dev/Q.
In order to display correct url inside FF export, we need to use the same data.

As explained here, please implement the functionnality inside fact finder export.

It's normally just an sql modification deployable without dependancies on P deployement (to confirm).

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: @Nabil : Please estimate time to implement on Q/P + add technical specfications in the ticket description.
Status?

Issues found during test of DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreator3:

  • Category1, Category2, Category3, Category4, Category5, Category6, Category7 => change back from nameSeo to name
  • TypeNameNormalized => use the new database field typeNameSeo

The new version of the FF export is now ready. Please check on Q after deployment of v3.4.2.

Note: please note that it will be available as first step only for CH-DE.
Great news, thank you Nabil for the speed !!!

100% of the url in ch_de search results are rewritten.

It's good on Q.
=> Ready for P if this solution is deployed on every channel

Yes, this solution will be used to export all FF channels. We were just waiting for your feedback.

Note: this solution will be also used for all channels on Q.

We still have discrepancy between FF and the hybris rewriting
Exemple on :
http://www.distrelec.ch/de/automation/fach-und-datenbuecher/fachbuecher-auf-englisch/c/cat-L3D_525533 on any product ID.

I reopen the ticket.

Hi Pierre,
Is deployed on Q and FF export has run already. Please test on Q, thx.
BR, Rafael

Hi Rafael and Nabil,
I still find issue on Q.
Exemple on http://test.distrelec.ch/de/automation/fach-und-datenbuecher/fachbuecher-auf-englisch/c/cat-L3D_525533,
I find http://test.distrelec.ch/de/modern-optical-engineering---07-136360/p/18416182 redirected to http://test.distrelec.ch/de/modern-optical-engineering-07-136360/p/18416182
the fix is not yet deployed to Q.
Ok, no problem, I'll wait for the next Q deploy.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6641] SEO - Url Rewriting - Optimization - Sitemaps Integration
item.description:
Observations :

  • Our Url rewriting is going to be optimized.
  • The sitemap are generating list of rewrited urls independantly to the rewrite module of hybris.
  • The sitemaps must contain final destination url (no redirections).

Demands :

  • Implement the new url rewriting rules inside the sitemaps.
  • Do not deploy on P url rewritting optimization without sitemap corrected rewritting.

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Url Rewriting - Optimization - Sitemaps Integration

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please check on the DEV system ( http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/sitemap_index.xml )
checked here http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-6547?focusedCommentId=38085&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-38085
Status?!

Pierre is checking on DEV System.

Note: all tickets related to SEO, are fixed on DEV.
Please check on DEV.

rewriting correctly implemented inside sitemaps.
Ready for P
Has been deployed to Q - Please test, thanks.

Hi,
I discovered an issue in the sitemap generation. I already fixed it and will be deployment with v3.4.0.

Can you send me CH Q sitemap ?
(we can't send them on prod without a full verification.)
I made some bug fixing and some optimizations. My changes will be available in the next version.

Please provide them to me, we don't go live on sitemap without a check.
thx.
According to Rafael Burlet, the next Q deployment ( v3.4.0 ) will be on Friday 22.05.2015 at 15:00.

Hi,

here is the generated sitemap after the fix http://test.distrelec.ch/sitemap_index.xml. Please check.
Hi Pierre, please verify, thx.
status?
The new sitemap generation on Q is running. I will inform Pièrre as soon as the export finishes.
Sitemaps in review
Q is extremely slow, it take longuer than expected to verify samples (I can in averege crawl 0.3 uri per second....)

After full review, the sitemap are ok on Q.
=> It's ready for P

Hi Nabil,

I found a big issue on the sitemaps.
Since last deployment you are generating /en/ language url for domain without english channel.
For example, ch & de need the channel /en/ and have it, but it, lt, at... don't have active english channel but the /en/ url are inside the sitemap.
Please correct asap, google is crawling billions of useless /en/ url now
I found the issue, I will fix it for version v3.4.4 which should be deployed on Q this week.
Great news, thx for your fast support !!!
The deployment of the version v3.4.4 is done on Q, I created and started an export job for AT.
Ok, great, I'll review that tomorrow.
It is ready for testing on Q. Please check the sitemap for AT.

It's ok on Q.
=> Ready for P
